creator: bryana@ilm.com
text:
When calling Response.setHeader("location", "XXX" ), the HTTP response code
should be set to 302.  In milestone 4, the response is:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK

but it should be

HTTP/1.1 302 Found

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Setting header to location doesn't do any magic. It just sets a header. 
You must set explicitely the return code.

It is true, we do some magic for content-type - and we shouldn't. As long 
as you have an explicit method for setting something, you should use it. I'm 
not even sure the Location header implies a 302 error ( it's true a 302 
needs a location, but you may use the header in other responses ).

creator: bryana@ilm.com
text:
This may be true, but in Tomcat 3.1, the status code is set to 302 (see original 
message output "HTTP/1.1 302 Found".  However, if the status code is not set to 
302, the browser will ignore the "Location" (at least this is true in netscape 
4.x) header directive, and no redirection will occur.  How "backwards" 
compatible will Tomcat 3.3 be with 3.1?
